summary: This is an email from September 17, 2019, providing an update on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell. It details that Maxwell's boyfriend, Scott Borgenson, was contacted by police in Manchester By the Sea, MA, and that Maxwell was with him but left due to media scrutiny. The FBI is also tracking a cell phone believed to belong to Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigative update; was staying with her boyfriend Scott Borgenson but left after media scrutiny. The FBI is tracking a cell phone believed to belong to her.

persons.name: Scott Borgenson
persons.context: Identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's boyfriend who lives in Manchester By the Sea, MA. Police were in contact with him in August 2019, and Maxwell was staying with him before leaving.

connections.description: Described as boyfriend-girlfriend; Maxwell was staying with Borgenson at his residence.

events.title: Police contact with Scott Borgenson
events.description: Police in Manchester By the Sea, MA, were in contact with Scott Borgenson regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's whereabouts.

events.title: FBI investigative update email
events.description: An email was sent providing an update on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, including her association with Scott Borgenson and efforts to track her cell phone.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was staying with her boyfriend, Scott Borgenson, in Manchester By the Sea, Massachusetts, in August 2019.
Maxwell left Borgenson's residence after increased media scrutiny surrounding her.
The FBI was actively tracking a cell phone they believed belonged to Ghislaine Maxwell and had subpoenaed for subscriber information.
Local police had a good relationship with Scott Borgenson and had been in contact with him regarding Maxwell.
